trans-unit.source: Views in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Views in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for using Transact-SQL views in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for using Transact-SQL views in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Views in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Views in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: Views are particularly useful in SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Views are particularly useful in SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: They can be used in a number of different ways to improve the quality of your solution.
trans-unit.target: They can be used in a number of different ways to improve the quality of your solution.

trans-unit.source: This article highlights a few examples of how to enrich your solution by implementing with views.
trans-unit.target: This article highlights a few examples of how to enrich your solution by implementing with views.

trans-unit.source: There are some limitations that also need to be considered.
trans-unit.target: There are some limitations that also need to be considered.

trans-unit.source: Architectural abstraction
trans-unit.target: Architectural abstraction

trans-unit.source: A very common application pattern is to re-create tables using CREATE TABLE AS SELECT (CTAS) followed by an object renaming pattern whilst loading data.
trans-unit.target: A very common application pattern is to re-create tables using CREATE TABLE AS SELECT (CTAS) followed by an object renaming pattern whilst loading data.

trans-unit.source: The example below adds new date records to a date dimension.
trans-unit.target: The example below adds new date records to a date dimension.

trans-unit.source: Note how a new object, DimDate_New, is first created and then renamed to replace the original version of the object.
trans-unit.target: Note how a new object, DimDate_New, is first created and then renamed to replace the original version of the object.

trans-unit.source: However, this can result in table objects appearing and disappearing from a user's view in the SSDT SQL Server Object Explorer.
trans-unit.target: However, this can result in table objects appearing and disappearing from a user's view in the SSDT SQL Server Object Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Views can be used to provide warehouse data consumers with a consistent presentation layer whilst the underlying objects are renamed.
trans-unit.target: Views can be used to provide warehouse data consumers with a consistent presentation layer whilst the underlying objects are renamed.

trans-unit.source: Providing access to the data through a view means users don't need to have visibility of the underlying tables.
trans-unit.target: Providing access to the data through a view means users don't need to have visibility of the underlying tables.

trans-unit.source: This provides a consistent user experience whilst ensuring that the data warehouse designers can evolve the data model and also maximise performance by using CTAS during the data loading process.
trans-unit.target: This provides a consistent user experience whilst ensuring that the data warehouse designers can evolve the data model and also maximise performance by using CTAS during the data loading process.

trans-unit.source: Performance optimization
trans-unit.target: Performance optimization

trans-unit.source: Views are a smart way to enforce performance optimized joins between tables.
trans-unit.target: Views are a smart way to enforce performance optimized joins between tables.

trans-unit.source: For example the view can incorporate a redundant distribution key as part of the joining criteria to minimize data movement.
trans-unit.target: For example the view can incorporate a redundant distribution key as part of the joining criteria to minimize data movement.

trans-unit.source: Another reason might be to force a specific query or joining hint.
trans-unit.target: Another reason might be to force a specific query or joining hint.

trans-unit.source: This guarantees that the join is always performed in an optimal fashion and is not dependent on the user remembering to construct the join correctly.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees that the join is always performed in an optimal fashion and is not dependent on the user remembering to construct the join correctly.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: Views in SQL Data Warehouse are metadata only.
trans-unit.target: Views in SQL Data Warehouse are metadata only.

trans-unit.source: Consequently the following options aren't available:
trans-unit.target: Consequently the following options aren't available:

trans-unit.source: There is no schema binding option
trans-unit.target: There is no schema binding option

trans-unit.source: Base tables cannot be updated through the view
trans-unit.target: Base tables cannot be updated through the view

trans-unit.source: Views cannot be created over temporary tables
trans-unit.target: Views cannot be created over temporary tables

trans-unit.source: There is no support for the EXPAND / NOEXPAND Hints
trans-unit.target: There is no support for the EXPAND / NOEXPAND Hints

trans-unit.source: There are no indexed views in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: There are no indexed views in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see [SQL Data Warehouse development overview][].
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see [SQL Data Warehouse development overview][].
